Params: {3: "A rhythmic buzzing pierces through Trojan's hazy consciousness. As she instinctively tries to move, pain surges through her body."}
{3: "With a hoarse groan, Trojan fights through the pain, her arm inching desperately toward the terminal that Bridget left within arm's reach."}
{3: 'With a soft chime, the terminal connects.'}
{2: "Save your strength. We're trying to pinpoint your location.", 3: '28'}
{3: 'Following those two faint, mumbled words, the terminal falls completely silent.'}
{3: 'You instinctively call out to the terminal twice more. There is no response.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Karenina', 3: "Hold up, we're coming with you. Teddy, where are you?", 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Teddy', 3: "I'm still trying to lock onto their signal source. What, you think this mine's an open field? Like we can pinpoint it in seconds?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: 'And let you go in alone? This is hardly the time for that kind of talk.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: "The mine's collapsed twice, and that's not counting deliberate sabotage. You really think you can navigate it safely without a professional guide?", 4: '2'}
{2: "Wasn't Engineering Force supposed to rescue those from Support Force that stayed behind?", 3: '60'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: "Their mission scope doesn't go nearly as far. Aren't Bridget and Trojan even deeper down?", 4: '2'}

{2: 'Karenina', 3: "Engineering Force has its protocols. In situations like this, they can only conduct rescue operations at the upper levels. Going any deeper would be reckless. I won't let my people take such unnecessary risks.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: "But I can take that risk myself. I'm already here, and Bridget's in trouble—there's no way I'm just going to stand by and watch.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: "I've located the general area of the communication terminal. We need to hurry up.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: "While I don't have any geological expertise, judging from the fluctuations and interruptions in the signal, the situation down there is getting worse.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'After a quick equipment check, they join a newly prepared Engineering Force team and descend deeper into the mine together.'}
{3: 'Blades flash through the air as Lucia slices through the Corrupted, revealing a Construct lying beneath it.'}
{3: 'Before Karenina can speak, two team members are already jogging over. They kneel down as they have countless times before and begin treating the fallen Construct with practiced efficiency.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Engineering Force Member A', 3: "Penetrating wound in the abdomen. Vital signs are poor, but we've still got hope here.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Engineering Force Member B', 3: "You handle the wound—use Kit Three for first aid. I'll secure the frame. Captain, we're pulling back now.", 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Karenina', 3: "Fall back. Alert the other squad members on your way back—search only at this depth, following standard time limits. Don't proceed any deeper.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'The two members nod in acknowledgment and disappear around the corner, carrying the injured person.'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: "Sigh... It's just the two of us now.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: "Teddy, where's the signal coming from? Which way should we go?", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Teddy remains hunched over her keyboard, all the while without looking up from her keyboard as her fingers fly across the keys.'}

{2: 'Teddy', 3: "Look, I don't know which way to go. Sure, I hacked into the mine's infrastructure system, but the cave-ins and battles have wrecked too much damage—the data's all scrambled now.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: "I can only pinpoint the general direction. Can't tell you exactly how to get there—it's not like I'm the architect of this place.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: "Besides, even if the actual architect showed up right now, they probably wouldn't know how to get through either.", 4: '2'}
{3: 'With an exasperated sigh, Teddy finally looks up and points to a side wall.'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: "It's down this way, but... what, you planning to smash open a path with that hammer?", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: '...Hey Lucia, do you remember how we got up here in the first place?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lucia', 3: "I remember, but it doesn't really matter. Like Teddy said, most of these tunnels are either buried or altered now.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: 'The few remaining official paths might be blocked by equipment, and Kurono has all the access permissions for the lower levels.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: "And don't forget, we've already hit two dead ends just now.", 4: '2'}
{2: "Let's head down first. We'll try to figure out the right path once we've gone deep enough.", 3: '123'}
{2: 'Karenina', 3: 'Looks like this is our only option for now.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Skych stops in front of a room, growling softly while pawing at the door.'}
{2: 'Skych', 3: "Moni... what was it again... Oh right, monitoring room. That's what it's called.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'The gentle giant hand suddenly exerts its strength, causing the metal door to groan and warp under tremendous force.'}
{3: 'Skych enters the room, finding the scene both familiar and foreign to his memories. For a moment, he loses focus as his perception wavers, while memories and reality blur together in his mind.'}
{3: "As a monitor-like device catches Skych's eye, his demeanor shifts to one of certainty, as if he's finally found what he's been looking for."}
{3: 'Skych clenches his fist and suddenly lashes out at the device with explosive force.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Skych', 3: "Ah... that's right, this is it—this is the monitoring room!", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Skych', 3: "You're all evidence, and I'm not leaving any traces. Norman is clean. It's just Kurono that's filthy.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'As Skych growls and wreaks havoc in the room, a figure briefly flashes past the doorway.'}
{3: 'Bridget glances at the "Storage Room" sign on the door, then carefully peeks inside to check on Skych.'}
{3: 'Sensing someone watching him, the massive figure quickly turns around, stirring up a gust of wind that sends shattered equipment parts flying in all directions.'}
{3: 'Bridget quickly withdraws behind the door as her mechanical components whir into high gear.'}
{3: 'Too afraid to even lift a finger, she takes a hard swallow.'}
{2: 'Skych', 3: 'Ah... yes, the mines are crawling with rats. They wear human skin and leech off Norman like parasites.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'After a brief pause and hearing no further sounds, Skych slowly turns back around. His clouded pupils fill with disgust as he mutters to himself and crushes the objects in his hands.'}
{3: 'Witnessing this from outside the door, Bridget takes careful, measured steps, inching away from the room as quietly as possible.'}
{3: 'Once at a safe distance, Bridget suddenly breaks into a sprint toward the monitoring room.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Bridget', 3: "Huff... puff... Good thing he's lost it. I need to hurry before he comes to his senses...", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Despite the considerable distance between them, the echo of her footsteps inevitably carries back to where she had been.'}
{3: "The faint echo of footsteps pierces through Skych's clouded mind, granting him a moment of clarity."}
{3: 'His towering figure suddenly goes still. Inch by inch, he turns his head, scanning every corner of the room.'}
{3: 'The giant narrows its eyes, leaning out of the room to peer into the darkness at the end of the corridor.'}
